svg.text: Acronyms & Key Concepts (3/3): SOTA & Third-Party Terms

text.tspan: AffordanceNet
• Definition: A SOTA model that learns what actions (affordances) are possible on an object (e.g., "can be cut").
BEHAVIOR-1K
• Definition: A benchmark for testing complex, long-horizon tasks in 1,000 human-centric home activities.
Bridge V2 / RH20T
• Definition: Public robotics datasets used for training and augmenting our custom data.
G1 (Unitree G1)
• Definition: A humanoid robot from Unitree that is a target platform for GRC's data generation project.
Gazebo / PyBullet / OmniGibson
• Definition: Simulation environments used for evaluation and benchmarking.
Gemini / GPT-4V / Llama-3
• Definition: Third-party LLMs from Google, OpenAI, and Meta, used for CoT reasoning and data annotation.
ManipBench / PhysBench
• Definition: Benchmarks for testing manipulation skills and intuitive physics reasoning.
Neo4j
• Definition: A commercial graph database, which we will use to build our symbolic RTKB.
NVIDIA Omniverse / IsaacSim / COSMOS
• Definition: The high-fidelity, physics-based simulation platform used to generate synthetic data.
OpenVLA / π0 / RT-2-X / Octo
• Definition: SOTA VLA models that serve as our baselines and integration targets.
RBY-1 (Rainbow Robotics RBY-1)
• Definition: The dual-arm mobile robot that serves as our primary hardware platform.
